proposals.templatetags.proposal_filters module¶

class proposals.templatetags.proposal_filters.ExtraDocumentsNode(var_name, study)[source]¶

Bases: django.template.base.Node

This node handles adding a documents object for a given study, by first getting the study object from the context.

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

render(context)[source]¶

Return the node rendered as a string.

proposals.templatetags.proposal_filters.get_extra_documents(parser, token)[source]¶

Adds a variable to the context with a list of extra documents objects for the specified proposal

Usage: {% get_study_documents VARIABLE_NAME PROPOSAL_OBJECT %} params: VARIABLE_NAME: the name of the variable to store the list in PROPOSAL_OBJECT: the variable which contains the proposal object

proposals.templatetags.proposal_filters.get_study_documents(parser, token)[source]¶

Adds a variable to the context with the documents object for the specified study

Usage: {% get_study_documents VARIABLE_NAME STUDY_OBJECT %} params: VARIABLE_NAME: the name of the variable to store the object in STUDY_OBJECT: the variable which contains the study object

proposals.templatetags.proposal_filters.get_verbose_field_name(app_label, model_name, field_name, value=None)[source]¶

Returns verbose_name for a field.

Return a unordered list of with all possible values for a model

proposals.templatetags.proposal_filters.show_selected(selected_values)[source]¶

Return a unordered list of with all possible values for a model, with the selected ones in bold.
